description.plain:
The White Stripes were a 2000s rock duo from Detroit, consisting of Jack White and Meg White. They had a sound that mixed classic blues with smart, boisterous, and vibrant punk rock.

The group became rock stars and Grammy winners in only a few short years. Assisting in that transition was intrigue.

The pair was a once-married couple who pretended to be siblings and, for a while, insisted on dressing in alternating red and white outfits. The chaffing riffs that drove the duo’s best tracks, such as 2003’s “Seven Nation Army”, testify to the importance of rock’s abrasive and experimental nature.

annotatable.title: The White Stripes

body.plain:
The White Stripes were a 2000s rock duo from Detroit, consisting of Jack White and Meg White. They had a sound that mixed classic blues with smart, boisterous, and vibrant punk rock.

The group became rock stars and Grammy winners in only a few short years. Assisting in that transition was intrigue.

The pair was a once-married couple who pretended to be siblings and, for a while, insisted on dressing in alternating red and white outfits. The chaffing riffs that drove the duo’s best tracks, such as 2003’s “Seven Nation Army”, testify to the importance of rock’s abrasive and experimental nature.

songs.full_title: Seven Nation Army by The White Stripes
songs.title: Seven Nation Army

description.plain: Jack White uses an effects pedal to make his guitar sound like a bass and howls about a rage so intense, he could take on an army all by himself. Result: the greatest riff of the decade and a massive, career-changing hit that every college marching band in the nation plays to this day.

translation_songs.title: The White Stripes - Seven Nation Army

songs.lyrics:
141 ContributorsTranslationsDeutschSeven Nation Army Lyrics
I'm gonna fight 'em off
A seven nation army couldn't hold me back
They're gonna rip it off
Takin' their time right behind my back
And I'm talkin' to myself at night because I can't forget
Back and forth through my mind, behind a cigarette

And the message comin' from my eyes says, "Leave it alone"

Don't wanna hear about it
Every single one's got a story to tell
Everyone knows about it
From the Queen of England to the Hounds of Hell
And if I catch it comin' back my way, I'm gonna serve it to you
And that ain't what you want to hear, but that's what I'll do

And the feelin' comin' from my bones says, "Find a home"
You might also like

I'm goin' to Wichita
Far from this opera forevermore
I'm gonna work the straw
Make the sweat drip out of every pore
And I'm bleedin' and I'm bleedin' and I'm bleedin' right before the Lord
All the words are gonna bleed from me and I will think no more

And the stains comin' from my blood tell me, "Go back home"
114Embed

songs.full_title: We're Going to Be Friends by The White Stripes
songs.title: We’re Going to Be Friends

description.plain:
Off of The White Stripes' third album, White Blood Cells, “We’re Going to Be Friends” was a contrast to the garage rock and blues style that the White Stripes were known for. However, the song still shared the trait of simplicity regarding composition, arrangement and performance that was associated with the White Stripes as well. Easy lyrics and a soothing melody to accommodate the song’s simple story – a boy’s experience of his first days at school. The song has the feel of a lullaby, and to expand on this, the music video features Jack White singing the song to a sleeping Meg White:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PKfD8d3XJok

Despite the song’s simple appearance, there are many interpretations and discussions of the song’s lyrics, such as the song possibly commentating on the three phases of life: birth, adulthood, death.

The piece also features a female character, Suzy Lee, whose name is also the title of a song in the band’s self-titled first album, The White Stripes.

“We’re Going To Be Friends” also gained national popularity as the cult classic film, Napoleon Dynamite, used the song for its opening title sequence, which can be seen on Vimeo here

songs.embed_content: Read “We're Going to Be Friends” by The White Stripes on Genius

songs.lyrics:
44 ContributorsWe’re Going to Be Friends Lyrics
Fall is here, hear the yell
Back to school, ring the bell
Brand new shoes, walking blues
Climb the fence, books and pens
I can tell that we are gonna be friends
I can tell that we are gonna be friends

Walk with me, Suzy Lee
Through the park and by the tree
We will rest upon the ground
And look at all the bugs we found
Safely walk to school without a sound
Safely walk to school without a sound

Here we are, no one else
We walk to school all by ourselves
There's dirt on our uniforms
From chasing all the ants and worms
We clean up and now it's time to learn
We clean up and now it's time to learn

Numbers, letters, learn to spell
Nouns and books, and show and tell
Playtime, we will throw the ball
Back to class, through the hall
Teacher marks our height against the wall
Teacher marks our height against the wall
You might also like
And we don't notice any time pass
We don't notice anything
We sit side by side in every class
Teacher thinks that I sound funny
But she likes the way you sing

Tonight I'll dream, while I’m in bed
When silly thoughts go through my head
About the bugs and alphabet
And when I wake tomorrow, I'll bet
That you and I will walk together again

I can tell that we are gonna be friends
Yes, I can tell that we are gonna be friends19Embed

songs.title: Fell in Love with a Girl
songs.title_with_featured: Fell in Love with a Girl

description.plain:
“Fell In Love With A Girl” was released as the second single off of White Blood Cells.

The video for this song was one of the first brickfilms to get mainstream attention.  It topped Pitchfork’s best videos of the decade list.

50 ContributorsFell in Love with a Girl Lyrics
Fell in love with a girl
I fell in love once and almost completely
She's in love with the world
But sometimes, these feelings can be so misleading
She turns and says, "Are you alright?"
I said, "I must be fine 'cause my heart's still beating"
"Come and kiss me by the riverside, yeah
Bobby says it's fine, he don't consider it cheating, now"

Red hair with a curl
Mello-Roll for the flavor, and the eyes were peeping
Can't keep away from the girl
These two sides of my brain need to have a meeting

Can't think of anything to do, yeah
My left brain knows that all love is fleeting
She's just looking for something new, yeah
I said it once before, but it bears repeating now

Ah, ah
Ah, ah
Ah, ah
Ah, ah
You might also like
Can't think of anything to do, yeah
My left brain knows that all love is fleeting
She's just looking for something new
Well, I said it once before, but it bears repeating now

songs.full_title: The Hardest Button to Button by The White Stripes
songs.title: The Hardest Button to Button

description.plain:
“The Hardest Button to Button” is the third single taken off The White Stripes' 2003 album Elephant. The song is about a kid growing up in a broken home.

It was a quick song to write, one of the few that actually began with White sitting at the piano and genuinely being struck by an almost completely formed idea. He wrote the lyrics at home, but fleshed out its signature rhythmic thrust in the studio with Meg.

It’s best remembered for its iconic stop-motion music video, directed by Michel Gondry. At first, the band was reticent to use Gondry’s idea – especially Jack White, who’d recently shattered his left index finger in a car accident and would have to mime playing the song for hours with a large black cast on his hand. This incident so affected White that it’s actually reflected on the single’s Saul Bass-inspired cover (alongside his obsession with the number 3). On top of that, he’d already had another idea: a Jim Jarmusch-directed piece about Thomas Edison’s execution of Topsy the elephant, to star Philip Seymour Hoffman.

Gondry’s idea won out and the video was shot over three 16-hour days on location in the Upper West Side. Due to all the gear that had to be hauled around (32 identical drum kits, 32 amps and 16 microphone stands), all the locations were within about 600 feet from each other. Though the amps were rented, the drum kits had to be bought outright. To prevent eBay scalping, all 32 kits were later donated to a local school of music. It also features a cameo by Beck (who’d had some previous experience with Gondry) as the man in the white suit who gives Jack White the “box with something in it”. Meg White has since called the video her favorite.

The single and the video were a massive success. The single peaked at #8 in November. In 2006, the band made a cameo in an episode of The Simpsons, where an extended homage to this video proceeds after Bart’s therapist recommends he take up drumming. In 2010, the song was included in the video game Rock Band 3. In 2011, Time Magazine named it one of the 30 Best Music Videos of All Time.

songs.embed_content: Read “The Hardest Button to Button” by The White Stripes on Genius

songs.lyrics:
34 ContributorsThe Hardest Button to Button Lyrics
We started living in an old house
My ma gave birth and we were checking it out
It was a baby boy, so we bought him a toy
It was a ray gun, and it was 1981

We named him 'Baby', he had a toothache
He started crying, it sounded like an earthquake
It didn't last long, because I stopped it
I grabbed a rag doll and stuck some little pins in it

Now we're a family, and we're alright now
We got money, and a little place to fight now
We don't know you, and we don't owe you
But if you see us around, I got something else to show you


Now it's easy when you don't know better
You think it's sleazy? Then put it in a short letter
We keep warm, but there's just something wrong with you
Just feel that you're the hardest little button to button
You might also like
I had opinions that didn't matter
I had a brain that felt like pancake batter
I got a backyard with nothing in it
Except a stick, a dog, and a box with something in it

The hardest button to button
The hardest button to button
The hardest button to button

songs.full_title: Icky Thump by The White Stripes
songs.title: Icky Thump

description.plain:
The title song and the first track on the album, it has very  abrupt tempo and melody changes.

“Icky Thump” follows the story of a white American who goes to Mexico looking for a good time, he meets a woman who offers him a place to sleep. He treats her rudely and ends up getting robbed blind.



The song is also a brief commentary on immigration.

songs.full_title: Ball and Biscuit by The White Stripes
songs.title: Ball and Biscuit

description.plain: Built on a traditional 12-Bar Blues chord progression,  “Ball and Biscuit” is the longest song the duo has ever laid to tape, at 7 minutes and 20 seconds. With its screeching guitars, simple, thudding drums and Jack’s spoken-word delivery, the song laments about a drug-riddled night with his female companion.

annotatable.link_title: Little Acorns by The White Stripes
annotatable.title: Little Acorns

songs.lyrics:
13 ContributorsLittle Acorns Lyrics
When problems overwhelm us and sadness smothers us, where do we find the will and the courage to continue?  Well the answer may come in the caring voice of a friend, a chance encounter with a book, or from a personal faith.  For Janet, help came from her faith, but it also came from a squirrel.  Shortly after her divorce, Janet lost her father then she lost her job, she had mounting money problems.  But Janet not only survived, she worked her way out of despondency and now she says, life is good again.  How could this happen?  She told me that late one autumn day when she was at her lowest she watched a squirrel storing up nuts for the winter, one at a time he would take them to the nest.  And she thought, if that squirrel can take care of himself with a harsh winter coming on, so can I.  Once I broke my problems into small pieces, I was able to carry them, just like those acorns, one at a time

Take all your problems and rip 'em apart
Oh, oh, oh-oh-oh
Carry them off in a shopping cart
Oh, oh, oh-oh-oh
Another thing you should've known from the start
Oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
The problems in hand are lighter than at heart
Oh, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh

Be like the squirrel, girl, be like the squirrel
Oh, oh, oh-oh-oh
Give it a whirl, girl, be like the squirrel
Oh, oh, oh-oh-oh
And another thing you have to know in this world
Oh, oh, ah-oh-oh
Cut up your hair, straighten your curls
Well, your problems hide in your curls

Oh, oh, oh-oh-oh
Oh, oh-oh
Oh, oh-oh-oh
Oh, oh, ohYou might also like1Embed

songs.full_title: Blue Orchid by The White Stripes
songs.title: Blue Orchid

description.plain:
The opening track of Get Behind Me Satan takes inspiration from the Bible, as most of the album it is off of does, but its main meaning is actually about child abuse. Blue Orchid was the name of a Russian-run child pornography organization. This ties right in with the ongoing theme of losing purity throughout this song.

Source

songs.full_title: Black Math by The White Stripes
songs.title: Black Math

description.plain:
I was thinking about a time in high school when I turned my books in to the math teacher and said, ‘I refuse to learn from you anymore.’ The song is about asking questions. A lot of people are taught just to regurgitate information. People don’t care if you learn anymore. Opinion gets trampled on.
-Jack White

songs.full_title: Hotel Yorba by The White Stripes
songs.title: Hotel Yorba

description.plain:
“Hotel Yorba” is the lead single from The White Stripes' 2001 LP White Blood Cells. The song mixes elements of country and garage rock.

Built in 1923, The Hotel Yorba used to be an actual hotel in southwest Detroit. The song was even recorded in room 206—the building now serves as government-subsidized housing.



The White Stripes singer, Jack White said that, as a child, he heard rumors that The Beatles had once stayed at the hotel.

Much of the music video for the song was filmed outside of the hotel—the band was denied entrance and are apparently banned for life.

body.plain:
“Hotel Yorba” is the lead single from The White Stripes' 2001 LP White Blood Cells. The song mixes elements of country and garage rock.

Built in 1923, The Hotel Yorba used to be an actual hotel in southwest Detroit. The song was even recorded in room 206—the building now serves as government-subsidized housing.



The White Stripes singer, Jack White said that, as a child, he heard rumors that The Beatles had once stayed at the hotel.

Much of the music video for the song was filmed outside of the hotel—the band was denied entrance and are apparently banned for life.

songs.full_title: Well It’s True That We Love One Another by The White Stripes (Ft. Holly Golightly)
songs.title: Well It’s True That We Love One Another
songs.title_with_featured: Well It’s True That We Love One Another (Ft. Holly Golightly)

description.plain:
The flash-based website that accompanied the release of “Acoustic Recordings 1998–2016”, has this to say about the song:

Meant partly to be an homage to the Mama’s and the Papa’s “Creeque Alley,” this track was recorded at Toe Rag Studios in London in November 2001 as a de facto testing of the studio capabilities, a test that ultimately led to the band recording the rest of Elephant there in May 2002. The song also features vocals from the Headcoatees' Holly Golightly.

songs.full_title: I Just Don't Know What to Do with Myself by The White Stripes
songs.title: I Just Don’t Know What to Do with Myself
songs.title_with_featured: I Just Don't Know What to Do with Myself

description.plain:
This song was first recorded and released  in 1964 by Dusty Springfield

Then 2 years later in  1966, Dionne Warwick released her cover of the song

Then in 2003, The White Stripes released the cover of this song on their highly successful album Elephant.

songs.full_title: The Union Forever by The White Stripes
songs.title: The Union Forever

description.plain:
“The Union Forever” is a song inspired by Orson Welles' 1941 film Citizen Kane. In an interview with Spin magazine, White Stripes lead singer Jack White explained that some of the lyrics were taken from the film (which he claimed to have watched over 3 dozen times).

I was thinking about different things people said in the film. I wrote them down and some of them started to rhyme, so it worked out

In 2003, Warner Brothers, who own the rights to the film, threatened The White Stripes with a lawsuit over copyright-infringement, but never followed through.

songs.full_title: Apple Blossom by The White Stripes
songs.title: Apple Blossom

description.plain:
This track from the Stripes’s sophomore LP is a notable departure from the music that came before.  Leading towards this track, the album features a simple but raw blending of blues and punk. This changes that, embracing a more of a soul vibe, while retaining that raw sound that encompasses the record.

Lyrically, the song has Jack encourages his lover to let him help with her problems. He doesn’t like that she’s sad and depressed, and will do anything to make her happy.

The track became notable in the band’s discography after being used in Quentin Tarantino’s 2015 film The Hateful Eight.  Here is the scene that it shows up in.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u_lzQ475J1A

songs.lyrics:
16 ContributorsApple Blossom Lyrics
Hey, little apple blossom
What seems to be the problem?
All the ones you tell your troubles to
They don't really care for you
Come and tell me what you're thinking
'Cause just when the boat is sinking
A little light is blinking
And I will come and rescue you

Lots of girls walk around in tears
But that's not for you
You've been looking all around for years
For someone to tell your troubles to

Come and sit with me and talk awhile
Let me see your pretty little smile
Put your troubles in a little pile
And I will sort 'em out for you

Lots of girls walk around in tears
But that's not for you
You've been looking all around for years
For someone to tell your troubles to
You might also like

Let me see your pretty little smile
Put your troubles in a little pile
And I will sort them out for you

'Cause you want

"Don't go away"
'Cause I want
